public class DateUtil

Utility class to format dates and times.

Method Detail

formatDate

public static final java.lang.String formatDate(java.lang.Integer day,
                                                java.lang.Integer month,
                                                java.lang.Integer year)
Get a date in the form MonthDayYear where Mmm is a 3-letter month abbrev, day is of the form Dth and year is of the form YYYY (where D and Y are digits and th is the appropriate number extension for the day.

Parameters:
day - day of month (1-based)
month - month (0-based, January=0)
year - 4-digit year

formatTimePeriod

public static final java.lang.String formatTimePeriod(long timePeriod)
Formats a time period in legible terms - not a date represented as a long, but a period of time (eg processing time)

Parameters:
timePeriod - time period to format

formatTime

public static final java.lang.String formatTime(java.lang.Integer hour,
                                                java.lang.Integer minute,
                                                java.lang.Integer second,
                                                java.lang.Integer ampm,
                                                java.lang.Integer zoneOffset)

buildDateString

public static final java.lang.String buildDateString(long millis)
Build a date string of the form yyyy-mm-dd-hh:mm:ss

buildDateString

public static final java.lang.String buildDateString(java.lang.Integer year,
                                                     java.lang.Integer month,
                                                     java.lang.Integer day,
                                                     java.lang.Integer hour,
                                                     java.lang.Integer minute,
                                                     java.lang.Integer second)
Build a string of the form yyyy-mm-dd-hh:mm:ss

Parameters:
year - 4-digit year
month - month (1-based, January=1)
day - day of month (1-based)
hour - 24-hour clock-based hour (0-23)
minute - minute in hour (0-based)
second - second in minute (0-based)

buildYMDString

public static final java.lang.String buildYMDString(long millis)
Create a string of the form yyyy-mm-dd from the time indicated by the millis.

Given integers for year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds; get the indicated time in millis.

getTimeInMillis

public static final long getTimeInMillis(java.lang.Integer year,
                                         java.lang.Integer month,
                                         java.lang.Integer day,
                                         java.lang.Integer hour,
                                         java.lang.Integer minute,
                                         java.lang.Integer second)
Translate the given date into milliseconds.

Parameters:
year - 4-digit year
month - month (1-based, January=1)
day - day of month (1-based)
hour - 24-hour clock-based hour (0-23)
minute - minute in hour (0-based)
second - second in minute (0-based)

parseDate

public static final long parseDate(java.lang.String dateString)
Get the number of milliseconds represented by the date string of the form: ".*yyyy-mm-dd-hh:mm:ss.*".

parseDateComponents

public static final java.lang.Integer[] parseDateComponents(java.lang.String dateString)
Get the year, month, day, hour, minute, second data contained in the date string. If components are not specified in the string, then their values will be null.

Returns:
null if no date can be parsed or an Integer[6] array where some elements in the array may be null.
